machine_types.description: High-precision CNC machines for stone and metalworking, featuring multi-axis control for complex geometries.
Automated saws for cutting granite and marble with high-speed, water-cooled blades.
Machines for surface finishing of stone, equipped with automated abrasive tools and precision sensors.
Integrated systems for cutting, shaping, and curing composite materials for aerospace and automotive.

applications.name: Natural Stone Processing
applications.description: Cutting and polishing marble and granite for construction, requiring high precision to avoid material waste.

applications.name: Metalworking for Precision Parts
applications.description: Machining metal components for industrial equipment, critical for maintaining tight tolerances.

applications.name: Composite Material Fabrication
applications.description: Producing lightweight composite parts for aerospace, ensuring structural integrity and quality.

applications.name: Surface Finishing for Decorative Stone
applications.description: Polishing stone surfaces for aesthetic applications, with minimal operational impact if disrupted.

key_features.description: PLC-based systems with sub-millimeter accuracy for complex machining tasks.
Enables remote diagnostics and updates via encrypted channels for maintenance.
Ensures only verified firmware is loaded, preventing unauthorized modifications.
Integrates with OT network zones to isolate critical control functions.
Records security events for analysis, ensuring traceability of unauthorized access.

operational_environment.description: Industrial facilities for stone, composite, and metal processing with high dust and noise levels.

conditions.network_type: Segmented industrial networks with DMZ for IT-OT integration

common_threats: Ransomware targeting control systems, disrupting production and causing downtime.
MitM attacks on industrial protocols, compromising data integrity.
Data manipulation in HMI interfaces, leading to incorrect process parameters.

assumptions_justifications.assumption: Machines incorporate advanced automation and control systems.
assumptions_justifications.justification: Based on Breton’s leadership in CNC machinery and ISO 23125 standards for machine tools.

assumptions_justifications.assumption: Support for secure industrial protocols like OPC UA and PROFINET.
assumptions_justifications.justification: Aligned with IEC 62443-4-2 CR5, ensuring secure data flow in IACS environments.

assumptions_justifications.assumption: High dust levels in operational environment require robust physical security.
assumptions_justifications.justification: Stone processing generates dust, necessitating IEC 62443-3-3 physical access controls.

assumptions_justifications.assumption: Machines support Industry 4.0 features like digital twins.
assumptions_justifications.justification: Breton’s advanced machinery aligns with Industry 4.0 trends per NIST SP 800-82.

assumptions_justifications.assumption: Firmware signing and incident logging are implemented.
assumptions_justifications.justification: Required by IEC 62443-4-2 CR3 and CR6 for system integrity and event response.
